column2: Total number of orbiting satellites that can be used for military purposes.
Total number of spies available for clandestine operations.
'The dinosaurs became extinct because they didn't have a space program. And if we become extinct because we don't have a space program, it'll serve us right!' - Larry Niven
All nations need spies regardless of their moral inclinations, but the secrets to be discovered are sometimes few and far between.
GDP is a sum of Consumption, Investment, Government Spending, and Exports, minus Imports.
Gross domestic product (GDP) refers to the market value of all goods and services produced within your country.
This option allows you to create a custom unit which is not based on existing templates.
The number of satellites currently in our possession
This is our current amount of high grade nuclear material
Unit makes use of inter-branch cooperation, making attack more efficient.
Start selection of allied operations provinces.
Finish selection of allied operations provinces.
Select all allied countries to perform operation.

Clicking this buttons begins drafting militia units from the population of the province. This will result in new militia units appearing in the province, costing us $SUP_COST$ supply and $NU_COST$ National Unity. Manpower cost will be $MP_COST$.

Clicking this button gives support to disaffected locals in the province, resulting in new guerrilla units appearing in there. Supporting guerrillas here will cost §Y$SUP_COST$§W supply and §Y$MON_COST$§W money. The number of guerrilla units depends on the province's population, revolt risk, and other random factors. Currently we predict that §Y$UNITS$§W units will emerge. Estimated end of the effects of support: §Y$DATE$§W.
Guerrillas in this province already have a supporter.
Guerrillas can only be supported in provinces that have a revolt risk higher than 10% and are located in a region which is close to a friendly region.
You are supporting guerrillas in this province.
Estimated end day of supporting effects : §Y$DATE$§W.
You don't have enough goods to support guerrillas in this province.
This province is not producing any resource at the moment.
Use this button to prioritize a province. Prioritized provinces are always first to being repaired and improved.
This option allows you to turn on/off autonomous division AI.
Equipment at $PERCENT$ of maximum unit strength.
Manpower at $PERCENT$ of maximum unit strength.
The required ammunition store already linked to $SLOT$

By researching improved precision ammunition and the doctrines to best implement it, cooperation between air and ground forces can be improved to achieve full effect against a target without putting friendly forces at risk.
This area can ship daily §Y$SIZE$§W of supplies and fuel. Currently we are shipping §Y$CURRENT$§W.
Without recogizing a country or being recognized them, you can not send a diplomat.
Recognition establishes diplomatic relations, allowing economic access and diplomatic actions.
Support is not available due to party being banned or your nation having exceeded §R$LIMIT$§W dissent limit.
Internet connection error or Wiki link not found
This moral leader will lead our nation until death and can only be removed by revolution or coup.
\n\nWe negotiate on behalf of our entire alliance and they are negotiating for their entire alliance.
You have §R$WARSCORE$%§W warscore but you need §G$TOTAL$%§W for demand this option.
You can select policies where the distance is up to §G$NUMBER$§W from current one.
This is the policy currently enacted
Press button to read free Wikipedia text

Declaring a defensive war will give us a mandate to defend a nation against invading forces located within the nations borders. It will grant us the ability to attack and defend against all enemy forces within the target nations borders and all provinces which that nation considers to be its cores. It does NOT give us the mandate to invade the nation(s) attacking our target, and the war will continue until either party surrenders.
Country is defended by $DEFENDERS$ in war against $AGGRESSOR$.
Country $DEFENDED$ attacked by them is defended by $DEFENDERS$ in limited defensive war.
Either you or the selected country are not a member of selected organization, so you cannot start voting.
Voting in §Y$NAME$ §Wis finished!\nVoting target was §Y$ACTOR$§W and initiated by §Y$INITIATOR$§W\n
However, the following countries voted against the action, causing the vote to fail: $LIST$.

This organization will, as of midnight, start voting on the issue §Y$ISSUE$§W on the floor. The vote was initiated by §Y$INITIATOR$§W and is targeted at §Y$RECIPIENT$§W. The voting process can be blocked by major nations, halting the entire proccess, and there is also always the option of abstaining from the vote if we are not prepared to chose sides.
Voting on §Y$ACTION$ §W has started in §Y$ORGANISATION$ §W, initiated by §Y$INITIATOR$§W, and targeted at §Y$ACTOR$§W.  As a member of this organization, you may now vote.
$COUNTRY$ is the target of this vote.
This vote affects all members of $ORG$.
This type of war allows you to defend the selected country against its aggressors.

This button freezes the factory's entire production. Click again to reactivate the factory's normal operations.
This button completely destroys the factory or stops its construction if in progress.
The efficiency of a factory shows the proportion of input resources to the output.
Shows how much workforce a factory is currently using compared to the maximum factory workforce at the factory's present level.
Maximum factory workforce at current level.

Current level of the factory. Levels that we are fully using, with the available workforce, are shown in §Ggreen§W. Partially used levels are in §Yyellow§W. Unused levels have an empty slot.\nWorkforce capacity: §G$WORKFORCE$§W Used workforce: §Y$USED$§W ($RATIO$)
